datafield.subfield: Die Epigramme des Leontios Scholastikos Minotauros, 2005:

t.p. (Leontios Scholastikos Minotauros) p. 10 ff. (Leontios Scholastikos; evidence drawn from his epigrams place his activity sometime in the 2nd half of the reign of Justinian, between 540-555, but nothing more definitive; 3 epigrams also give him the name "Minotauros", definitely not a patronymic but rather a nickname)
Dict. of Greek and Roman biography and mythology:
"Leontius", no. 20 (Scholasticus; a Greek of Constantinople, author of various epigrams contained in the Anthologia Graeca; lived in the reign of Justinian)
"Leontios", nr. 3 (Leontios Scholastikos; epigrammic poet; also named Minotauros, of the circle of Agathias, in the reign of Justinian)
"Leontios", Nr. 7 (L. Scholastikos; Greek epigrammic poet, nicknamed Minotauros; lived in the reign of the emperor Justinian)
